info.name: Xfers API
info.description:
![Xfers Developer API Documentation](https://www.xfers.io/images/xfersLogo.png)

Welcome to Xfers' API.  

# API Keys
To start developing, you need a sandbox account, please contact [sales@xfers.io](mailto:sales@xfers.io) if you don't have them yet.

Xfers uses API keys to allow access to the API. You can get your API key from your dashboard [Settings > API Tokens](https://sandbox-id.xfers.com/api_tokens) page. You will be redirected to a page similar to image below:

[![xfers_api_keys](http://docs.xfers.io/images/xfers-api-keys.png)](http://docs.xfers.io/images/xfers-api-keys.png)

You will need to include these API keys in the headers of your request
All endpoints are in HTTPS. Please do not attempt to hit our endpoint in HTTP.

### Types of API Keys

Type | Description  |
---- |  ------------ |
X-XFERS-APP-API-KEY | Used Only for Registration of New User
X-XFERS-USER-API-KEY| The majority of our APIs uses this

# Integration Guides
[Overview on integrating Xfers Wallet](https://www.lucidchart.com/publicSegments/view/0a2fe26d-3556-4dc5-a63a-b7b5adde1fb6/image.png)  
[Xfers Connect Flow](https://www.lucidchart.com/publicSegments/view/017a4cda-6a5d-4013-ae4f-6daf81175157/image.png)  
[Top up Flow](https://www.lucidchart.com/publicSegments/view/c29b0c13-0573-44b4-91f6-fe489cfa964e/image.png)  
[Transactional Flow](https://www.lucidchart.com/publicSegments/view/23b4e3b6-dce1-4b98-a2aa-30fc8648db75/image.png)  

# Setting up with Postman

To Setup using postman, choose your suitable environment and click `Run in Postman`.
Then, update the environment variable of the API keys.

![Postman Edit Script 1](https://duaw26jehqd4r.cloudfront.net/items/3v020B0e181J113D0P0R/Screen%20Shot%202018-11-02%20at%2015.11.29.png?v=5b81e47d)  
![Postman Edit Script 2](https://duaw26jehqd4r.cloudfront.net/items/173z2N1l0g2A012w240W/Screen%20Shot%202018-11-02%20at%2015.12.15.png?v=38f80a97)

# Environments

Country \ Environment | Sandbox | Production
----------- | ------- | -----------
Indonesia | https://sandbox-id.xfers.com/api/v3 | https://id.xfers.com/api/v3
Singapore | https://sandbox.xfers.io/api/v3 | https://www.xfers.io/api/v3

Notes:
- Your platform will have separate API keys for each environment.
- Data created or modified in each environment will not affect the other.
- Data cannot be transfered from one environment to the other.

# Changelog

=================== 2 October, 2018 ===================

**Summary** 
Release of the first version of the Xfers API Docs

formdata.description: `REQUIRED` | user's phone number
`REQUIRED` | SHA1-hex of (phone_no + X-XFERS-APP_SECRET_KEY)

request.description:
This API is used to start user registration by inputting phone number.  
After this API is called, an OTP SMS will be sent to that number.  

You can re-trigger this API again to re-send OTP to the same phone number after 1 minute.  

This OTP will expire in 10 minutes.  

The SMS format will be:
```
[XFERS] Your OTP is 123456. This is to set up payments for `merchant_name` . If this is not done by you, please report to http://bit.ly/XfersSupport
```

This API uses a pair of public Key and secret key.  
The header of this API uses public key called `X-XFERS-APP-API-KEY`.  
You will need `X-XFERS-APP-SECRET-KEY`  to generate signature in the request body.

item.name: Get User API Token / Submit OTP

request.description:
After user receives the OTP SMS, merchant's app should capture the OTP and pass it to Xfers via this API.  
This API will finish the registration and returns `user_api_token`.  
`user_api_token` is used to control the user's account.  
You should save the `user_api_token` for future usage. (to be put in the X-XFERS-USER-API-KEY in headers of other APIs)  

It will also return a is_fully_verified if they already have an Xfers account and have completed our KYC process.  

This API uses a pair of public Key and secret key.  
The header of this API uses public key called `X-XFERS-APP-API-KEY`.  
You will need `X-XFERS-APP-SECRET-KEY` to generate signature in the request body.

request.description:
To provide KYC data in order to change user from unverified status into fully verified status.  

The image/document provided us must be hosted in an URL then pass the URL to Xfers via this API.  
Make sure data type for your image is jpeg / png.  
Maximum size of the image/ document is 10 MB.  

After this data is sent, we will do some verifications on our side and may take some time before user gets fully verified.  

#### KYC Verification Notification
We highly recommend you to use callback_url in this API to be notified when verification will finish.

If you put a notify_url in KYC data submission, we will send you the callback with the following parameter when the verification is `successful` or `rejected`. You need to acknowledge the callback by responding with a HTTP 200 status when succesfully processed.

Parameter of the Callback Notification:

```json
{
   "id": "user_gksj43jgzgqv",
   "verification_status":false,
   "reason":"The NRIC Photo is too blur"
}
```

Name | Description 
---- | -------- 
id | A unique ID for the user
verification_status | `true` or `false`
reason | reason for verification status. Only applicable when verification_status is false

In Indonesia, fully verified user will be backed by a savings account.  
Thus, there are required parameters which are mother_maiden_name, id_front_url, selfie_2id_url.  
Additional data will speed up the KYC process.

response.name: success response

urlencoded.description: `REQUIRED` | URL to receive callback notifications on account changes
`REQUIRED` |  JSON Array of events to subscribe to. Currently only  `deposit` is available
`OPTIONAL` | A name that you can attach to this request. It can be useful for storing additional information. You will be provided with this field in your callback notification

request.description:
If you want that Xfers give a callback everytime user do a deposit, can call this API at the start of registration of the user. 

When you trigger this API for same user but different parameters (callback_url, name), the existing ones will be overwritten.  

##### Callback Notification Format

We will send HTTPS/HTTP POST to the URL you provided and you will need to acknowledge the callback by responding with a HTTP 200 status.

> Callback Format:


```json
{
  "notification_id": "5",
  "callback_id":"1",
  "name":"hello-world",
  "event_type":"deposit",
  "created_at":"2017-08-08T03:36:28Z",
  "user_contact":"83994956",
  "data": {
    "ledger_balance": 436750.00,
    "available_balance": 436750.00,
    "credit": 335000.00,
    "debit": 0.00,
    "details": "BCA Transfer"    
  }
}
```

Name | Type | Description | Value
---- | ---- | -------- | -----------
notification_id | string | A unique ID for this particular event| 5
callback_id | string | The ID of your callback registration| 1
name | string | The string you previously provided in the register request | hello-world
event_type | string | The type of event| deposit
created_at | string | When this event was triggered. In ISO8601 datetime format| 2017-08-08T03:36:28Z
user_id | string | User ID to identify user | user_gksj43jgzgqv
data | Array | Additional information about the event| Look at the below table

#### Additional information about the event

Key | Description| Value Type | Value 
---- | ---------|------------|-------
ledger_balance | Ledger balance of the user at this point in time | float| 436750.00
available_balance | Available balance of the user at this point in time | float| 436750.00
credit | How much was credited in this event | float| 335000.00
debit | How much was debited in this event | float| 0.00
details | Additional details. For deposit, it would be the bank the user did a transfer from | String| BCA Transfer

urlencoded.description: `REQUIRED` | URL to receive callback notifications on account changes
`REQUIRED` |  Array of events to subscribe to. This should be a valid JSON array. Refer to the section below on the types of events available
`OPTIONAL` | A name that you can attach to this request. It can be useful for storing additional information. You will be provided with this field in your callback notification

url.raw: {{base-api-url}}api/v3/user/activities?limit=50&start_date=2018-07-04T11%3A49%3A58%2B08%3A00 &end_date=2018-10-30T11%3A49%3A58%2B08%3A00 &offset=0&types=Credit Card, Charge, Payout, Deposit,Withdrawal&status=Completed, Refunded, Expired, Cancelled, Pending, Accepted, On_hold

query.description: `OPTIONAL` | Max number of results to return per page
`OPTIONAL` | Only show transactions of that type. Only “Credit Card”, “Charge”, “Payout”, “Deposit”, “Withdrawal” allowed. You can add additional types by separating with a comma.

query.value: Completed, Refunded, Expired, Cancelled, Pending, Accepted, On_hold
query.description: `OPTIONAL` | Only show transactions of that status. Only “completed”, “refunded”, “expired”, “cancelled”, “pending”, “accepted”, “on_hold” allowed. You can add additional types by separating with a comma. Note that putting “completed” will also return transactions with “paid” - you can take them to be the same.

request.description:
This API displays a user’s transaction history.  
If you query a user’s account, only transactions with your merchant account will be shown.  
I.e. user’s transactions with other merchants will not be displayed.

response.name: success response

query.description: `OPTIONAL` | Max number of results to return per page
`OPTIONAL` | Only show transactions of that type. Only “Credit Card”, “Charge”, “Payout”, “Deposit”, “Withdrawal” allowed. You can add additional types by separating with a comma.

`OPTIONAL` | Only show transactions of that status. Only “completed”, “refunded”, “expired”, “cancelled”, “pending”, “accepted”, “on_hold” allowed. You can add additional types by separating with a comma. Note that putting “completed” will also return transactions with “paid” - you can take them to be the same.

item.name: Get Transfer Info / Get VA Number

request.description:
API to get bank account number to be shown to user.  
Please consult with us to get topup instruction template text to be shown.

The common usage of this API is to parse the transfer_info_array given by us and parse it and use the VA numbers of the bank you want

#### For Virtual Account solution:  
This API is to get the Virtual Account Number to be displayed to the user

#### For non Virtual Account solution:  
This API will show the bank account number to do top up.  
Please consult with us as this solution will require user to use some other identifier to detect the deposit.

response.name: success response

query.description:
`OPTIONAL` |Use this to choose the bank you want to get the VA from.
Alternatively, you can call our API without using this parameter and just use the transfer_info_array.

request.description:
The following API will allow you to move money from user's account to merchant's account.  

In header X-XFERS-USER-API-KEY, You need to put `merchant's` api key. (As found in Dashboard > Settings > API Tokens).  
In the user_api_token in the body, You need to put `user's` api key. (As received from get_user_token API).

Retrieves the details of a charge that has previously been created.  
Supply the ID that was returned from your previous request, and Xfers will return the corresponding charge information.

This API will refund a charge.  
Both funds and fees in this transaction will be refunded to the `user's` Xfers account.  

Please use the merchant’s API key for this endpoint

request.description:
The following API will allow you to move money from merchant's account to user's account.

In header X-XFERS-USER-API-KEY, You need to put `merchant's` api key. (As found in Dashboard > Settings > API Tokens).  
In the user_api_token in the body, You need to put `user's` api key. (As received from get_user_token API).

Alternatively, You can also make a peer to peer transfer using this API by putting the 
sender's token in X-XFERS-USER-API-KEY in the header and putting the 
receiver's token in user_api_token in the body

Retrieves the details of a payout that has previously been created.  
Supply the unique payout ID that was returned from your previous request, and Xfers will return the corresponding payout information.

request.description:
This API will be used to attach a new bank account to a user.  
You will be able to withdraw user's balance to this bank account.  

In Indonesia Production, This API will return the detected_name as provided from the bank.  
The account_holder_name you provided and detected_name needs to be similar (doesn't need to be 100% match).

header.description: A HSTS Policy informing the HTTP client how long to cache the HTTPS only policy and whether this applies to subdomains.

header.description: Tells downstream proxies how to match future request headers to decide whether the cached response can be used rather than requesting a fresh one from the origin server.

Express Withdrawal has fees but will arrive at recipient bank within 24 hrs.  
Standard withdrawal is free but takes 2-3 business day to arrive at recipient bank.  
Defaults to `false`
`OPTIONAL` | URL to receive callback notifications on withdrawal status changes.
`OPTIONAL` | Use this param if you want to withdraw to another user’s bank account instead of your own.

request.description:
Withdrawal Time varies upon country. 
For Indonesia, withdrawal time is instantenous.
For Singapore, withdrawal time depends on whether it is an express withdrawal.

#### Withdrawal on Behalf
If you wish to withdraw to a bank account not belonging to you, add in user_api_token in the params.

Behind the scenes, Xfers does a payout of funds from your Xfers account to that user’s Xfers account, followed by a withdrawal. This is required for compliance purposes as we cannot directly withdraw funds to a bank account not belonging to you.

To clarify this:

Placing of xfers_api_token | Flow | Remark
--------------- |  ----------- | -----
merchant's token in header, user's token in body| merchant's Xfers account -> user's Xfers account -> user's bank Account | We call this `Withdrawal on Behalf`
user's token in header, nothing in body| user's Xfers account -> user's bank Account | this is the usual usage
merchant's token in header, nothing in body| merchant's Xfers account -> merchant's bank Account | This is usually done via Xfers Dashboard

#### Withdrawal notification
We highly recommend you to use callback_url in this API to be notified for withdrawal request status.

If you put a notify_url in your withdrawal, we will send you the callback with the following parameter when the withdrawal is `completed` or `failed`. You need to acknowledge the callback by responding with a HTTP 200 status when succesfully processed.

We will send `completed` callback after already reconfirmed with bank that the money has been sent.

Name | Type | Description | Value
---- | ---- | ----------- | -----
account_no | string | bank account no of withdrawal | 0393123432
amount | string | withdrawal amount | 125000
bank_abbrev | string | bank abbreviation of withdrawal | DBS
express | string |  Express/normal withdrawal | true
fees | string | Withdrawal Fee | 0
id | string | Xfers Generated Unique Key | contract_dd5a6b83
idempotency_id | string | The key you put in the withdrawal request | AZ0001
status | string | Status of transaction | "completed" or "failed"
value_date | string | Date of withdrawal completed as provided by partner bank. will only available for "completed" status | 2018-09-12

header.description: Specifies a URI that may access the resource. For requests without credentials, the server may specify '*' as a wildcard, thereby allowing any origin to access the resource.

header.name: Access-Control-Request-Method
header.description: Used when issuing a preflight request to let the server know what HTTP method will be used when the actual request is made.

header.name: CF-RAY
header.description: Custom header

header.name: Cache-Control

header.name: Connection
header.description: Options that are desired for the connection

header.name: Content-Encoding
header.description: The type of encoding used on the data.

header.name: Content-Length
header.description: The length of the response body in octets (8-bit bytes)

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: ETag
header.description: An identifier for a specific version of a resource, often a message digest

header.name: Expect-CT
header.description: Custom header

header.name: Server
header.description: A name for the server

header.name: Strict-Transport-Security
header.description: A HSTS Policy informing the HTTP client how long to cache the HTTPS only policy and whether this applies to subdomains.

header.name: Vary
header.description: Tells downstream proxies how to match future request headers to decide whether the cached response can be used rather than requesting a fresh one from the origin server.

header.name: X-Content-Type-Options
header.description: The only defined value, "nosniff", prevents Internet Explorer from MIME-sniffing a response away from the declared content-type

header.name: X-Frame-Options
header.description: Clickjacking protection: "deny" - no rendering within a frame, "sameorigin" - no rendering if origin mismatch

header.name: X-Request-Id
header.description: Custom header

header.description: Custom header

header.description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) filter

request.description:
This is not an API call.  
You can do mock topup via our dashboard.  
Login to the dashboard, click the yellow button at the middle of the page.  
Then, choose the VA number as shown in the get_transfer_info API and then click `Simulate Bank Transfer`.

#### Indo Mock Topup Instruction
![Indonesia Mock Topup Instruction](https://duaw26jehqd4r.cloudfront.net/items/1G3m0K2T0i1O1z2T0E3g/Screen%20Shot%202018-11-02%20at%2011.18.36.png?v=4567587b)

#### Singapore Mock Topup Intsruction
![Singapore Mock Topup Instruction](https://www.xfers.com/sg/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2018/07/simulate-bank-transfer-26jul2018.png)
